Computer.name: SEATTLE TECH LAB
Computer.file:
All new programs are uploaded to the FTP server. Use SCP to download and UPLOAD to upload files.
--RootKit-- Run by typing "PortHack". Experimental password-cracking tool that can find any password, if ALL required ports are open!
--SSHCrack-- Cracks Telnet/SSH ports
--FTPBounce-- Cracks FTP ports
--SMTPOverflow-- Cracks SMTP mail ports
--DECHead-- Reads info about encrypted files (.dec)
--Decypher-- Opens encrypted files, if correct password is given

This is a complete list of the most common usernames and passwords I have found different terminals use on the ARPANET. Some give (backdoor) ADMIN access, some don't. Try at your own risk!
USERNAMES: admin - (DEFAULT SUPERUSER) guest - (NO PASSWORD) help - (SYSTEM HELP) user - (DEFAULT ACCOUNT) root - (SYSTEMUSER) ftp - (UPLOADS)
PASSWORDS: 000001 - (DEFAULT) games - (GAME SERVERS) root - (SYSTEMUSER) uploader - (FTP) password (STANDARD) admin - (SUPERUSER) 12345678 - (BBS) webmaster - (WEBSERVERS) alpine - (FAX AND MAIL)
HINTS: Sometimes people use passwords with close relation to their family and loved ones to make the password more unique. Try looking up their names in different databases, to find more info about them.
- Malvin and Jim, Seattle Tech Lab
